metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40516 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WeeChat before 3.2.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted WebSocket frame that trigger an out-of-bounds read in plugins/relay/relay-websocket.c in the Relay plugin.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40516` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

weechat - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-core - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-curses - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-guile - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-headless - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-lua - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-perl - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-php - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-plugins - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-python - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-ruby - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-tcl - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: weechat package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
